p: The solvents used for the physiochemical analyses of VCO are methanol, ethanol, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hexane, and Wijs solution. The chemicals used to evaluate the antioxidant capacity and total phenolic content (TPC) are 2,2‐diphenyl‐1‐picrylhydrazyl radical (DPPH), Folin–Ciocalteu reagent, hydrochloric acid (HCl), potassium iodide (KI), nitric acid (HNO 3), ethanol, sodium thiosulfate (Na 2S 2O 3), sodium hydroxide (NaOH), potassium hydroxide (KOH), acetic acid (CH 3COOH), hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2), chloroform (CHCl 3), and sodium carbonate (Na 2CO 3). All the solvents and chemicals were obtained from Sigma‐Aldrich Co. (St. Louis, MO), Merck (Darmstadt‐Germany) or RCl Labscan (Thailand), and they were used as received without any further purification.
